raw.title: [BIP-495] Enable frxETH/sfrxETH metastable pool gauge [Optimism]
raw.author: 0x9f74662aD05840Ba35d111930501c617920dD68e
raw.body:
### PR with Payload
https://github.com/BalancerMaxis/multisig-ops/pull/666

**Summary:**

> We request adding frxETH/sfrxETH metastable pool on optimism to BAL gauge

**References/Useful links:**

> Link to
> • [Website](https://frax.finance/)
> • [Documentation](https://docs.frax.finance/)
> • [Github Page](https://github.com/FraxFinance/frax-solidity)

**Protocol Description:**

> frxETH is Frax's wrapped ETH token and sfrxETH is its staked interest bearing version

**Motivation:**

> As a joint effort with FRAX and Beethoven X, we aim to increase liquidity of FRAX, sFRAX, frxETH, sfrxETH, to make Balancer a liquidity hub for frax assets on optimism. The BAL gauge will facilitate the process.

**Specifications:**

1. **Governance:** FRAX governance process can be seen [here](https://docs.frax.finance/smart-contracts/governance) and their snapshot [here](https://snapshot.org/#/frax.eth).
2. **Oracles:** Rate provider contract for [sfrxETH](https://optimistic.etherscan.io/address/0xf752dd899F87a91370C1C8ac1488Aef6be687505), the pool does not rely on additional oracles.
3. **Audits:** See [here](https://docs.frax.finance/other/audits)
4. **Centralization vectors:** see [here](https://docs.frax.finance/frax-ether/overview).
5. **Market History:** See [here](https://docs.frax.finance/frax-ether/frxeth-and-sfrxeth)
6. **Value:** Balancer will earn the protocol fee on interest bearing sfrxETH in the pool and so will LPs. The BIP-19 flywheel will incentivize TVL to grow here with trading volume and our staked ethereum pillars will continue to have Balancer as their ideal liquidity destination.

Link to pool: https://op.beets.fi/pool/0xa71021492a3966eec735ed1b505afa097c7cfe6f00000000000000000000010d
Link to child gauge: https://optimistic.etherscan.io/address/0xc46AB6Aa92F7c30B8Fb1D445b4B957203EbBbd6e
Root gauge: https://etherscan.io/address/0x5622821A3b993f062Ff691478Bbb7d551c167321#code

**Specification**:

The Balancer Maxi LM Multisig eth:`0xc38c5f97B34E175FFd35407fc91a937300E33860` will interact with the GaugeAdderv4 at `0x5DbAd78818D4c8958EfF2d5b95b28385A22113Cd` and call the addGauge function with the following arguments:
gauge(address):`0x5622821A3b993f062Ff691478Bbb7d551c167321`
gaugeType(string): `Optimism`

Additionally, this pool is requesting `core pool` status as per BIP-457

choices: No, this is not the way

raw.title: [BIP-580] Enable sfrxETH / cbETH pool [Base]
raw.author: 0x9f74662aD05840Ba35d111930501c617920dD68e
raw.body:
### PR with Payload
https://github.com/BalancerMaxis/multisig-ops/pull/884

## Summary:

* This is a proposal to enable a Balancer gauge for a sfrxETH/cbETH pool on Balancer on Base.
* This will be a core pool.
* The pool has been launched [here](https://app.balancer.fi/#/base/pool/0x98bedb6a3c0b6feebbe662e6419481a6877d9681000000000000000000000104)

## References/Useful links:

Link to:

• [Website](https://frax.finance/)

• [Documentation](https://docs.frax.finance/)

• [Github Page](https://github.com/FraxFinance/frax-solidity)


## Protocol Description:

sfrxETH is a staked interest bearing version of FRAX’s staked ETH (frxETH). Coinbase Wrapped Staked ETH (cbETH) represents your staked Ethereum (ETH) in a tradable form. You can unwrap cbETH at any time. cbETH provides flexibility to sell, transfer, or use it. You can move cbETH to a personal wallet and trade it outside the Coinbase platform.

## Motivation:

As a joint effort with FRAX, we aim to increase liquidity of FRAX, sFRAX, frxETH, sfrxETH, to make Balancer a liquidity hub for Frax assets on Base. The BAL gauge and core pool status will facilitate the process.

## Specifications:

* Governance: FRAX governance process can be seen [here](https://docs.frax.finance/smart-contracts/governance) and their snapshot [here](https://snapshot.org/#/frax.eth).
* Oracles: Chainlink feed for rate can be found [here](https://data.chain.link/feeds/base/base/sfrxETH-frxETH).
* Audits: See [here](https://docs.frax.finance/other/audits)
* Centralization vectors: see [here](https://docs.frax.finance/frax-ether/overview).
* Market History: See [here](https://docs.frax.finance/frax-ether/frxeth-and-sfrxeth)
* Value: Balancer will earn the protocol fee on interest bearing sfrxETH and cbETH in the pool and so will LPs. The BIP-19 flywheel will incentivize TVL to grow here with trading volume and our staked ethereum pillars will continue to have Balancer as their ideal liquidity destination.

Link to pool: https://app.balancer.fi/#/base/pool/0x98bedb6a3c0b6feebbe662e6419481a6877d9681000000000000000000000104

Link to child gauge: [0x1cadBEFEB5461a671CfAAf5faC237aF00baC0B1c](https://basescan.org/address/0x1cadBEFEB5461a671CfAAf5faC237aF00baC0B1c#code)

Link to root gauge: [0x3CFfb5d5Db1dA8AA58908e54C03a7f8a7edb233c](https://etherscan.io/address/0x3CFfb5d5Db1dA8AA58908e54C03a7f8a7edb233c)

## Technical Specification:

The Balancer Maxi LM Multisig eth:0xc38c5f97B34E175FFd35407fc91a937300E33860 will interact with the GaugeAdderv4 at 0x5DbAd78818D4c8958EfF2d5b95b28385A22113Cd and call the addGauge function with the following arguments:

gauge(address): `0x3CFfb5d5Db1dA8AA58908e54C03a7f8a7edb233c`

gaugeType(string): `Base`

choices: No, this is not the way

raw.author: 0x9f74662aD05840Ba35d111930501c617920dD68e

### PR with Payload
https://github.com/BalancerMaxis/multisig-ops/pull/737

**Summary:**

> We request adding sFRAX/sfrxETH weighted pool on optimism to BAL gauge as an uncapped core pool 

**References/Useful links:**

> Link to
> • [Website](https://frax.finance/)
> • [Documentation](https://docs.frax.finance/)
> • [Github Page](https://github.com/FraxFinance/frax-solidity)

**Protocol Description:**

> sFRAX is a staked interest bearing version of FRAX stable coin and  sfrxETH is a staked interest bearing version of FRAX's staked ETH (frxETH). 

**Motivation:**

> As a joint effort with FRAX and Beethoven X, we aim to increase liquidity of FRAX, sFRAX, frxETH, sfrxETH, to make Balancer a liquidity hub for frax assets on optimism. The BAL gauge and core pool status will facilitate the process.

**Specifications:**

1. **Governance:** FRAX governance process can be seen [here](https://docs.frax.finance/smart-contracts/governance) and their snapshot [here](https://snapshot.org/#/frax.eth).
2. **Oracles:** Rate provider contract for [sfrxETH](https://optimistic.etherscan.io/address/0xf752dd899F87a91370C1C8ac1488Aef6be687505) and for [sFRAX](https://optimistic.etherscan.io/address/0xDe3B7eC86B67B05D312ac8FD935B6F59836F2c41).
3. **Audits:** See [here](https://docs.frax.finance/other/audits)
4. **Centralization vectors:** see [here](https://docs.frax.finance/frax-ether/overview).
5. **Market History:** See [here](https://docs.frax.finance/frax-ether/frxeth-and-sfrxeth)
6. **Value:** Balancer will earn the protocol fee on interest bearing sFRAX and sfrxETH in the pool and so will LPs. The BIP-19 flywheel will incentivize TVL to grow here with trading volume and our staked ethereum pillars will continue to have Balancer as their ideal liquidity destination.

Link to pool: https://op.beets.fi/pool/0x2feb76966459d7841fa8a7ed0aa4bf574d6111bf00020000000000000000011d
Link to child gauge: https://optimistic.etherscan.io/address/0x758D3297d9D9325EFb6DD424a7B2EdCaB47e309E
Link to root gauge: https://etherscan.io/address/0x8c596E8D1b3Be04a6cAa1B1152b51c495f799a16#code

**Specification:**

The Balancer Maxi LM Multisig eth:`0xc38c5f97B34E175FFd35407fc91a937300E33860` will interact with the GaugeAdderv4 at `0x5DbAd78818D4c8958EfF2d5b95b28385A22113Cd` and call the addGauge function with the following arguments:
gauge(address):`0x8c596E8D1b3Be04a6cAa1B1152b51c495f799a16`
gaugeType(string): `Optimism`

Additionally, this pool is requesting `core pool` status as per BIP-457

choices: No, this is not the way

raw.title: [BIP-505] Enable 40DFX-20USDC-40TEL Gauge with 2% emissions cap
raw.author: 0x9f74662aD05840Ba35d111930501c617920dD68e
raw.body:
### PR with Payload
https://github.com/BalancerMaxis/multisig-ops/pull/681

**Summary:**
DFX Finance’s proposal to add a gauge for the 40DFX-20USDC-40TEL - Polygon

**References/Useful links:**
Link to:
Website: [Main Website](https://dfx.finance/), [dApp](https://app.dfx.finance/)

• Documentation: [Gitbook](https://docs.dfx.finance/), [Medium](https://medium.com/@dfxfinance)

• Github Page: [Github](https://github.com/dfx-finance)

**Protocol Description:**

DFX Finance is a decentralized foreign exchange (FX) protocol that facilitates the seamless exchange of fiat-backed stablecoins denominated in a growing number of currencies. Using a hyper-efficient AMM, optimized for low volatility trading, DFX provides FX swaps with rates that will beat any bank, money changer, or FX platform. DFX is the governance token of DFX Finance which allows users to vote on protocol changes and initiatives of the DAO, and also allows users to receive boosted emissions on deposits within the DFX ecosystem.

**Price History DFX:**

Price History for DFX can be found on [Coingecko](https://www.coingecko.com/en/coins/dfx-finance)

**Motivation:**

The DFX token on L2s such as Arbitrum and Polygon is migrating from a bridged token to a Chainlink CCIP token. As well, DFX Finance is committed to continue to engage in the Hiddenhand Finance ecosystem in a meaningful way to further deepen DFX liquidity onchain.

**Specifications:**

1. Governance: DFX tokens serve as the governance token for the DFX Finance protocol. DFX token holders can vote on governance proposals through DFX’s snapshot. DFX forum is also used to discuss potential protocol changes and improvements.
2. Oracles: DFX token does not rely on any external oracles. The DFX stablecoin pools uses Chainlink for its real world forex price feeds to facilitate efficient stablecoin swaps close to the spot price. The feeds can be found here: [Decentralized Price Reference Data | Chainlink](https://data.chain.link/ethereum/mainnet/fiat)
3. Audits: DFX has engaged with multiple auditors including engagements with Trail of Bits, Haechi, and Zellic to audit the DFX smart contracts.
4. Centralization vectors: Treasury functions are controlled by a 2/4 multisig including treasury yield farming, and paying bribes.
5. Market History: DFX has been transferable since March 2021.
6. Value: This pool will be the primary source of liquidity for DFX on Arbitrum and Polygon

**40DFX-20USDC-40TEL - Polygon**
Pool: [0xc260f3c5a57caf193d1813d8fd0a02442073d6fa](https://polygonscan.com/address/0xc260f3c5a57caf193d1813d8fd0a02442073d6fa)
Gauge: [0x15639b2F9159DFD4ACF8eCf56222421ead906826](https://polygonscan.com/address/0x15639b2F9159DFD4ACF8eCf56222421ead906826)
Root Gauge: [0xe9b5f4d892Df284a15Ec90A58bd4385E57964f18](https://etherscan.io/address/0xe9b5f4d892Df284a15Ec90A58bd4385E57964f18)

**Specification**:

The Balancer Maxi LM Multisig eth:`0xc38c5f97B34E175FFd35407fc91a937300E33860` will interact with the GaugeAdderv4 at `0x5DbAd78818D4c8958EfF2d5b95b28385A22113Cd` and call the addGauge function with the following arguments:
gauge(address): `0xe9b5f4d892Df284a15Ec90A58bd4385E57964f18`
gaugeType(string): `Polygon`

choices: No, this is not the way

decision.summary: The proposal to enable the APW-ETH gauge with a 2% cap on Ethereum Mainnet is strongly supported by voters and aligns with prior successful similar proposals. Forum sentiment is positive to neutral, reflecting community agreement. Market metrics indicate positive price and TVL impact.
key_arguments_for: Strong unanimous voting timeline metrics favor 'Yes, let's do it' option with perfect lead and stability
Positive forum sentiment supporting the proposal's rationale and technical specifications
Similar past proposals with similar governance changes were successful and did not negatively impact token price or TVL
Market impact metrics show a positive price change (+4.07%) and TVL increase (+6.54%) during the event window
key_arguments_against: No significant negative sentiment detected in forum or voting data
No historical lessons suggesting risks or failures for similar changes

evidence.quote: Forum sentiment: 1 positive comment supporting the proposal, 1 neutral comment referencing the snapshot link.
Lead ratio by quartile and total lead ratios are 1.0 favoring the 'Yes, let's do it' choice with early and stable votes.

evidence.reference: Similar past proposals BIP-654 and BIP-653
evidence.quote: Both similar proposals recommended 'Yes, let's do it' and had positive price impacts, with no TVL decline.

available_choices: No, this is not the way
decision.ai_final_conclusion: Option 'Yes, let's do it ' selected with stance to keep 'Change'.
decision.ai_final_reason:
- Voting timeline strongly supports the 'Yes, let's do it' option with perfect lead and stability metrics.
- Forum sentiment is positive to neutral and aligns well with the recommendation, indicating community agreement.
- Similar past proposals with related gauge enabling actions were successful and did not cause negative market or TVL impacts.
- Market data during the event window shows positive price and TVL changes, supporting the proposal's expected benefit.
- Overall, the recommendation mirrors aggregated forum sentiment and historical lessons, maximizing long-term protocol health.
